title: Scholars GeoPortal
description: <p>Access a variety of Ontario and Canada-wide datasets available to current members of the Brock University community.</p>
subject: Ontario; Canada

title: Open Data Niagara Region
description: <p>Download GIS data layers for Niagara Region including cultural features, land use planning, recreation, transportation and more.</p>
subject: Niagara

title: Open Data Welland
description: <p>Download GIS data layers for the city of Welland including cultural features, land use planning, recreation, transportation and more.</p>
subject: Niagara

title: Open Data Niagara Falls
description: <p>Download GIS data layers for Niagara Falls including cultural features, land use planning, recreation, transportation and more.</p>
subject: Niagara

title: Ontario Open Data
description: <p>Metadata browser for all provincial data sources. Access may be restricted. Click the "Open Data" filter to browse immediate data downloads. Contact us if there is a resource you want that isn't ready for public download. Maintained by Land Information Ontario (LIO).</p>
subject: Ontario

title: NPCA Open Data
description: <p>Discover, explore and download geospatial data files relating to natural resources in the Niagara Peninsula Conservation Authority district.</p>
subject: NPCA; Niagara

title: Niagara Vector Data
description: <p>Licensed data includes building footprints, campgrounds, chambers of commerce, 2.5 metre contours, government facilities, schools, tourist information centres, township lots & concessions, waste management and wineries of the Niagara region. Additional vector layers are available from the <a href="https://niagaraopendata.ca/">Niagara Open Data</a> website. These data are useful for cadastral mapping, urban planning, tourism, transportation studies and more.</p>
subject: Niagara

title: Brock Campus GIS Data
description: <p>Data includes large scale layers such as contours (5 m), buildings, wooded areas, trees, hydro poles, sidewalks, ditches, culverts, roads, tennis courts, to name a few.<br><br>Data includes large scale layers such as:<br><br>buildings (2013)<br>contours (5m) (2001)<br>culverts (2001)<br>ditch (2001)<br>lighting (2014)<br>pavement (2014)<br>pavement markings (2014)<br>ponds (2001)<br>property (2010)<br>roads (2014)<br>sidewalk edges (2014)<br>tennis courts (2001)<br>traffic lights (2001)<br>trails (2001)<br>tree groves (2001)<br>trees (2014)<br>wetland (2001)<br>wooded area outline (2001)</p>
subject: Brock university

title: Soil Survey Complex
description: <p>Data set describing soil patterns of Southern Ontario. Attributes include soil name, texture, drainage and slope. Such data is useful for studies that require an overview of soil characteristics, such as: environmental impact assessments; erosion studies; agricultural capability and engineering studies.</p>
subject: Soil

title: Water Well Information System
description: <p>Point data representing water well locations in Ontario and Niagara. Using the well ID number, a manual search of the printed Groundwater Bulletin Report (MapBk TD 405 O58 2006) will provide further details including elevation, water kind, water use, depth to bedrock, depth to water and soil profiles. All details are available through the <a href="https://www.ontario.ca/environment-and-energy/map-well-records"> search tool. </a></p>
subject: Water Well

title: Natural Areas Inventory (NAI)
description: <p>Polygon data for the Niagara Watershed with attributes describing natural areas such as: cliffs, talus, rock, shoreline, bluff, sand, dunes, bog, marsh, agriculture (as open, shrub, treed, barren), woodland, thicket, swamp, hedgerow (as coniferous, deciduous, mixed) and aquatic features (as floating leaved shallow, submerged shallow, open water), and wetlands. These data are useful for large scale mapping for landuse or land cover analysis.<br><br>Extensive documentation is available under Related Information below.</p>
subject: Natural Areas;  NPCA

title: Niagara Natural Environment (NPCA)
description: <p>An inventory of the regulated natural environment within the Niagara watershed. Layers include:  shoreline mapping, floodplains, wetlands, riverine floodplains, top of slope, top of slope allowance, and wetland allowance.</p>
subject: Natural Environment;  NPCA

title: Source Water Protection Data (NPCA)
description: <p>GIS data layers related to NPCA Groundwater Vulnerability Analysis and Groundwater Recharge Areas including: highly vulnerable aquifers, significant ground recharge areas, catchment areas, rivers and watershed areas.<br><br>Prepared maps are included in the reports listed below under related information.</p>
subject: Water;  NPCA

title: Large Scale Surface Water Inventory (NPCA)
description: <p>GIS layers reflecting large scale (1:2k, 1:10k) surface water features of the Niagara Watershed such as waterbodies (lakes, ponds, reservoirs, large rivers, marshland), rivers, streams, creeks, ditches, hydronet basins and catchments, watersheds and subwatersheds. These data help identify and map surface water interactions with water and wastewater systems and other municipal infrastructure (storm water systems, culverts, bridges). <br><br>Stream Flow data is available under Related Information.</p>
subject: Water;  NPCA

title: Conservation Areas (NPCA)
description: <p>A single layer representing conservation areas under the Niagara Peninsula Conservation Authority jurisdiction with attributes including name, access fees and amenities (parking, trails, Bruce Trail access, boat launch, picnic tables, restrooms, hunting, education demos).</p>
subject: Conservation Areas;  NPCA

title: Digital Elevation Model 2002 (NPCA)
description: <p>A raster data set including a DEM (5 metre pixel resolution), hillshade layer and breaklines (2D shapefile) used to enhance the model for hydrologic purposes covering the Niagara Watershed.</p>
subject: DEM;  NPCA

title: 1m Contours and Digital Terrain Model (NPCA)
description: <p>A geodatabase of 1 meter contours, breaklines and mass points representing elevation characteristics of the Niagara Watershed.</p>
subject: Contours; DEM;  NPCA

title: Watershed Planning Areas (NPCA)
description: <p>Boundary file representing the Niagara Watershed Planning Areas. Attributes include simply the planning area name.<br><br>Details of each planning area can be found in planning documents accessed through the Watershed Explorer (indicated below under related information).</p>
subject: Water; NPCA

title: SWOOP Orthoimagery 2015
description: <p>High resolution aerial imagery (orthophotos) for Southwestern Ontario (including Niagara) captured in the spring of 2015. 1km tiles. These data are used in land use planning, land survey research, population and diversity studies, and utilities evaluation, to name a few.<br><br>Coordinate System: UTM - NAD'83, Zone 17<br> Imagery date: acquired between April 12 and May 23 2015<br>Ground pixel resolution: 20 cm<br>Format: jpeg2000<br>Approximate file size per tile: - 10 MB</p>
subject: Orthoimagery

Additional imagery for all of the Southwestern Ontario is available on <a href="http://geo.scholarsportal.info/#r/details/_uri@=4163035098$OGDE_SWOOP_2015">Scholars GeoPortal</a> in 1km tile segments. These data are used in land use planning, water management, urban studies and infrastructure, natural resources, to name a few.<br><br>Coordinate system: UTM - NAD'83, Zone 17<br>Imagery date: spring 2015<br>Ground pixel resolution: 20 cm<br>Format: SID, JP2<br>Approximate file size per tile: 2GB - 13GB<br>Organized by municipality</p>

title: WorldView-3 Satellite Imagery, May 9, 2015
description: <p>WorldView-3 satellite 1.5m multi-spectral remote sensing image including panchromatic (30cm), coastal, red, red edge, blue, green, yellow and near-infrared 1& 2 bands. Ortho Ready Standard high resolution satellite data used to study land use, land cover, agriculture, urban growth, transportation networks, deforestation, water pollution, and other earth surface features. Coverage includes Short Hills to Lake Ontario.<br><br>Satellite: WorldView-3<br>Scene Image ID: 055061395010_01_P001<br>Date: May 9, 2015<br>Format: GeoTIFF<br>Resolution: 30 cm (pan); 1.5 m (multi-spectral)<br>Sensor Mode: PAN/MS<br>Cloud Cover: 0%<br>Bands: panchromatic & multispectral, B, G, R and near-infrared<br>Image processing: Ortho-Ready Standard<br><br>Spectral Characteristics:<br><br>Coastal: 400-450<br>Blue: 450-510<br>Green: 510-580<br>Yellow: 630-625<br>Red: 630-690<br>Red Edge: 705-745<br>Near-IR1: 770-895<br>Near-IR2: 860-1040<br>Pan (B&W): 450-800</p>
subject: Remote sensing; Satellite Imagery

title: Niagara LiDAR
description: <p>Two Niagara datasets provide select coverage over the Niagara Falls area. LiDAR which stands for Light Detection and Ranging, is a remote sensing method that uses light in the form of a pulsed laser to measure variable distances to the Earth's surface. The result is a very detailed point cloud dataset allowing users to visualize the bare earth (last pulse return) or canopy (first pulse return) and anything in between.<br><br>The data sources below are sample datasets provided as is for teaching and research purposes. Students are encouraged to examine and process the imagery using Geographic Information Systems.<br><br>Niagara Falls<br>Original data is compressed in RAR format and unzipped using 7-Zip software. The resulting .las files provide LiDAR coverage over Niagara Falls to the Whirlpool gorge.<br><br>Location \DATA\Remote_Sensing\LiDAR_NiagaraFalls\<br>File type: RAR, .las<br>File size: 418 MB unzipped to 2.55GB<br><br>Niagara Falls (Terrasolid)<br>These data include a subset of the above Niagara Falls LiDAR collection with additional files prepared for use with Terrasolid software. Although the MDGL doesn't support this software, these data may be of use to the curious remote sensing explorer.<br><br>Location \DATA\Remote_Sensing\LiDAR_Niagara\<br>File type: .las, .lasd, .bin, .jp2<br>File size: 1.88 GB</p>
subject: LiDAR; Remote Sensing

title: Niagara Remote Sensing Imagery Index
description: <p>This index offers an interactive view of satellite imagery available over the Niagara Region. Imagery includes Landsat, Worldview, GeoEye, SPOT and LiDAR.</p>

title: LiDAR - Humber River
description: <p>Remote sensing LiDAR imagery sample of the Humber River area in Toronto. LiDAR (Light Detection and Ranging) is a remote sensing method that uses light in the form of a pulsed laser to measure variable distances to the Earth. This produces 3-dimensional information about the shape of the Earth and its surface characteristics. This dataset encompasses South Humber Park and King's Mill Park in Toronto, Ontario between Bloor St. W. and the Gardiner Expressway. It includes "bare earth" and "full feature" point clouds which depict the ground surface and built environment (man-made and natural), respectively. Accompanying the data are 50cm contours. The data is divided into 500m x 500m tiles following the UTM Grid System.<br><br>GENERAL SCENE DESCRIPTION (Please refer to imagery metadata document for specific details.)<br>LiDAR System: Leica ALS70<br>Project Number: 11357<br>Date: November, 2012<br>Format: Point Cloud<br>Point Density: >5 pts/m squared<br>Scene size: 2.1 square kilometers<br>Projection: UTM 17 NAD83<br>File Size: 2.16 GB<br><br><br>DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:<br>1m Grids (XYZ ASCII), Bare Earth and Full Feature<br>Summary Produced: April 25, 2013<br>Hillshade Images (Geotiffs), Bare Earth and Full Feature<br>50cm Contours (.Shp)<br>Point Cloud (LAS v1.2, ASPRS Classification, All Classes & Ground Class only)<br>Point Cloud (XYZI ASCII)</p>
subject: LiDAR; Remote sensing

title: 1934 Air Photo Mosaics of the Niagara Peninsula
description: <p>The 1934 air photo collection of Niagara has been digitized, mosaicked and georeferenced. The historical imagery is available in a variety of formats through this site. Historical air photos of the Niagara Peninsula were scanned, mosaicked and georeferenced for use with GIS software. These data are used to study changes in land use, urban growth, transportation networks, surface water features, shoreline changes and property assessment, to name a few.<br><br>Source of original air photos: Canada Department of Energy, Mines & Resources, 1934<br>Original scale: 1:16,000<br>Scanning Resolution: 600 dpi<br>Ground Pixel Resolution: 60cm<br>Format: GeoTIFF, ArcGIS image service<br>Projection: UTM NAD83 Zone 17N</p>
subject: air photo mosaics

title: 1954 Air Photo Mosaics of Niagara
description: <p>The 1954 air photo collection of Niagara has been digitized, mosaicked and georeferenced. Geotiff files are available for direct download and use in GIS software.  These data are used to study changes in land use, urban growth, transportation networks, surface water features, shoreline changes and property assessment, to name a few.<br><br>Source: Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources, 1954/1955<br>Original scale: 1:16,000<br>Scanning Resolution: 600 dpi<br>Ground Pixel Resolution: 60 cm<br>Format: GeoTIFF (LZW compression)<br>Alt Format: ArcGIS Online Image Service<br>Projection: UTM NAD83 Zone 17N</p>
subject: air photo mosaics

title: Ontario Parcel Data (Teranet)
description: <p>Property boundary files for Ontario municipalities. The Ontario Government (MNR), the Municipal Property Assessment Corporation (MPAC) and Teranet Entreprises Inc. have collaborated to develop a province-wide parcel data set. The data includes property boundaries and identifiers such as Assessement Roll Number (ARN) or property identification number (PIN), which can be linked to ownership report files.<br><br>The parcel data is used with Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and includes applications such as: taxation, land registration, land use planning, land management and business planning. The property boundaries may also be used as a base to georeference historical data such as Fire Insurance Plans.<br><br>Projection: Projected Lambert Conformal Conic; NAD 1983</p>
subject: Ontario; Parcel

title: Niagara Topographic Map Images, 1:25k 1960-1965
description: <p>Georeferenced 1:25,000 topographic maps of Niagara based on the first edition of the National Topographic Series (NTS)(1960-1965). Scanned and Georeferenced historical topographic maps of the Niagara area are available for download or viewing with ArcGIS online. These data are used to study changes in land use, urban growth, transportation networks, surface water features, shoreline changes and more.<br><br>Original Paper Series: Canada National Topographic Series, 1:25,000<br>Edition: 1/2 (1960-1965)<br>Scanning Resolution: 200 dpi<br>Ground Resolution: 3 meters<br>Format: GeoTiff, ArcGIS online image service<br>File Size:~23-30 megabytes per image<br>Coordinate System: GCS_NAD83_CSRS98</p>

title: Ontario Base Map (OBM) Data
description: <p>Seamless coverage of topographic features include: airports, buildings, contour lines (5 metre contour interval), spot heights, drainage, municipal boundaries, pits, quarries, roads, railways, utility lines, waterbodies and wetlands. Historic topographic data layers based on the Ontario Basic Mapping series (1:10,000) published by the Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources in the mid-1970s. Mapping was updated in the 1980s. Seamless coverage of features include: airports, buildings, contour lines (5 metre contour interval), spot heights, drainage, municipal boundaries, pits, quarries, roads, railways, utility lines, waterbodies and wetlands. This data is useful for topographic information available in the contours and spot height layers. Other layers do not contain detailed attribute records but are useful for visual purposes.</p>
subject: Topographic maps

title: Ontario Road Network (ORN) Data
description: <p>Geometry and attributes of Ontario's roads describing name, address ranges, direction of traffic flow, municipality, road classification and speed limit. The ORN is a combined effort of federal, provincial and municipal agencies providing users with a common data infrastructure across the province.</p>
subject: Ontario; Transportation

title: Ontario School Boards 2009-2010
description: <p>Ontario public and catholic school board boundary files published in 2009, updated in 2010. Data includes boundaries for 4 school board districts: Catholic - English and French (ec_09_10.shp, fc_09_10.shp) and Public - English and French. (ep_09_10.shp, fp_09_10.shp).<br><br>Data Producer: These files were provided by the GIS Unit, Enterprise Business Intelligence Operations, Data Collection and Decision Support Solutions Branch, Community Services I&IT Cluster, Government of Toronto, Ontario.</p>
subject: Ontario; School

title: Niagara Escarpment Plan 2014
description: <p>Published in June 2005, plan documents, maps and GIS data are available for research relating to this protected area. The Niagara Escarpment Plan includes policies for seven land-use designations (Natural, Protection, Rural, Recreation, Urban, Minor Urban and Mineral Resource Extraction), provides development criteria and establishes objectives for the Niagara Escarpment Parks System as 131 parks and protected areas.<br><br>The 2014 textual updates are available from the <a href="http://www.escarpment.org/landplanning/plan/index.php"> Niagara Escarpment Plan</a> website.</p>
subject: Niagara; Escarpment

title: Ontario Integrated Hydrology Data
description: <p>Stream network, hydrology enforced digital elevation model, flow direction grid, raster representation of the stream network.</p>
subject: Hydrology

title: Ontario Flow Assessment Tools III
description: <p>This is an interactive water resources assessment tool used to calculate watershed boundaries, 2011 land cover characteristics and flow statistics. The user selects a point along a river as the source point and the tool generates the watershed boundary. All results may be downloaded in shapefile or table format. A User Guide is available. </p>
subject: Hydrology

title: Provincial DEM Tiled Data Set
description: <p>A raster data set including a continuous surface of elevation (10 metre pixel resolution for Southern Ontario, 20 metre for Northern Ontario) for the province of Ontario. </p>
subject: DEM

title: Quaternary Geology of Ontario
description: <p>Layers defining landform deposits typical of geology in Ontario. Based on 1:1 million scale mapping. Accessible through OGSEarth. It is a seamless digital representation of Ontario's surficial geology. It was digitized from the 1:1,000,000 geologic map of quaternary data and compiled from engineering terrain and surficial geology maps. The data is a re-release of preliminary files released in May 1997. The digital version (ERLIS Data Set 14) illustrates the distribution of various quaternary sediments and landform deposits, such as: glacial tills, drumlins, moraines, eskers, sand dunes, and glacial escarpments. Geology attributes include: age, unit name, lobe, and material. Dune attributes include: angle and rotation.</p>
subject: Geology

title: Surficial Geology of Southern Ontario (1:50,000)
description: <p>Layers defining landform deposits typical of geology in Ontario. Based on 1:50,000 scale mapping. The Surficial Geology of Southern Ontario data set is a GIS based geological map that shows the distribution and characteristics of surficial units across Southern Ontario. It illustrates surficial deposit types, material types, geological features (e.g. drumlins, eskers) and general bedrock types and outcrops. The surficial geology of southern Ontario consists largely of varying types and thicknesses of deposits emplaced primarily during the Quaternary period. These surficial deposits overly a bedrock terrain consisting mainly of Phanerozoic sedimentary rocks that overlie older Precambrian rocks of the Canadian Shield. The data used in generating the map was derived from Quaternary maps, primarily at a scale of 1:50 000, completed by the OGS and Geological Survey of Canada (GSC) for most of southern Ontario over the past 40 years.</p>
subject: Geology

title: Bedrock Geology of Ontario (1:250,000)
description: <p>Layers defining bedrock features typical of geology in Ontario. Based on 1:250,000 scale mapping. Also available through OGSEarth. Data representing the solid rock underlying the Province of Ontario at a compilation scale of 1:250 000. Data includes: bedrock units, major faults, dike swarms, iron formations, kimberlites and interpretation of the Precambrian bedrock geology underlying the Hudson Bay and James Bay lowlands Phanerozoic cover.</p>
subject: Geology

title: Bedrock Topography and Overburden Thickness Mapping, Southern Ontario
description: <p>Raster grid files defining bedrock elevation and overburden drift thickness for Southern Ontario. Available through OGSEarth. </p>
subject: Geology

title: OGSEarth
description: <p>Use Google Earth to view OGS geology maps that are available from Geology Ontario. </p>
subject: Geology

title: Southern Ontario Land Resource Information System (SOLRIS)
description: <p>Grid and layer files describing landcover. Download "SOLRIS" from <a href="http://geo.scholarsportal.info/#r/details/_uri@=3228499737">Scholars GeoPortal</a>. Southern Ontario Land Resource Information System (SOLRIS) is a regional, ecologically based, land cover / land use inventory. It provides a comprehensive, landscape-level inventory of natural, rural and urban areas in Southern Ontario. The land cover / land use classification follows the standardized Ecological Land Classification for southern Ontario to describe, inventory and interpret land cover for ecoregions in southern Ontario. The inventory represents the landscape current to 2000 to 2002. Version 1.2 includes all of Southern Ontario with data classes including: exposed bedrock, shoreline, forest, agriculture (annual, mixed and perennial crop), vegetation, transportation, built-up areas and water. Detailed descriptions of each classification are included with the documentation available with the downloaded files. </p>
subject: Land Use

title: Provincial Landcover Ed.2 [Ontario, North of the Shield]
description: <p>Grid and layer files describing landcover north of the Canadian Shield. The Provincial Land Cover is a comprehensive, landscape-level inventory of natural, rural and urban areas in northern Ontario. The 2nd edition covers territory north of the southern boundary of the Canadian Shield. The classification was produced from 25-metre resolution satellite imagery (Landsat-7) and may not be well-suited to site-specific studies. The inventory represents the landscape from 1999 to 2002.<br><br>USE SOLRIS OR LANDCOVER 2002 GTA FOR SOUTHERN ONTARIO.<br><br>Data classes include: water (deep/shallow), settlement, sand/gravel/mine tailings, bedrock, mudflats, forest depletion - cuts, forest depletion -burns, forest - regenerating depletion, forest-sparse, forest-dense deciduous, forest - dense mixed, forest - dense coniferous, marsh - intertidal, marsh - supertidal, marsh - inland, swamp - deciduous, swamp - coniferous, fen - open, fen - treed, bog - open, bog - treed, tundra heath, agriculture - pasture/abandoned fields, agriculture cropland, other - unknown, other - cloud/shadow.</p>
subject: Land Use

title: TABI-1800 Thermal Imagery (Heber Downs CA)
description: <p>Sample thermal remote sensing imagery supplied by ITRES Research for academic purposes. This airborne thermal data offers a wide imaging array of 1800 pixels at 25 cm resolution. The TABI-1800 is a high-resolution airborne thermal mapper, offering a wide imaging array of 1800 pixels at 25 cm resolution. A sample image centred on Heber Downs Conservation Area near Macedonia Village, ON (north of Whitby) has been supplied for academic purposes by ITRES Research.<br><br>Applications for TABI-1800 include detection of underground tunnels, pipeline mapping, forest fire detection, heat loss surveys, and many other applications where there are even the subtlest temperature differences.<br>Read more: <a href="https://itres.com/sensor-line-1-high-fidelity-hyperspectral-sensor-system/">https://itres.com/sensor-line-1-high-fidelity-hyperspectral-sensor-system/</a></p><br><br>GENERAL SCENE DESCRIPTION (Please refer to imagery metadata document for specific details of each scene.)<br><br>Airborne sensor: TABI-1800<br>Aircraft velocity: 140 knots<br>Aircraft altitude: ~800m AGL<br>Bandwidth: Broadband MWIR Image<br>Spectral Range: Band 01 = 3.7-4.8 microns<br>Date: July 22, 2011<br>Format: TIFF<br>Spatial Resolution: 25cm<br><br><a href="https://brocku.ca/library/wp-content/uploads/sites/51/MDG-TABI1800-location.jpg?x60670">Location map</a></p>
subject: Thermal; Remote Sensing

title: Pelee Island Orthophotos [2004]
description: <p>High resolution aerial imagery (orthophotos) for Pelee Island in Essex Region acquired in the spring of 2004. This area is well-known for its vineyards and wine production.<br><br>Coordinate system: UTM - NAD'83, Zone 17<br>Aerial photography date: April 2004<br>Ground pixel resolution: 30cm & 50cm<br>Format: MrSID<br>Approximate file size: 41.2MB</p>
subject: Orthoimagery

title: Peterborough GIS data 2018
description: <p>Vector data including streets, hydrology, sidewalks, building footprints, bus stops, land use, parcel fabric (property boundaries), zoning and schools. Additional years include 2009 and 2015.</p>
subject: Peterborough

title: Peterborough GIS data 2009
description: <p>Vector data including streets, hydrology, sidewalks, bike trails, bus stops, property parcels, buildings, land use (agriculture, commercial, industrial, major institution, major open space, protected natural areas, residential, rural, urban fringe control area and village), floodplain boundary. These data provide a foundation on which basic mapping and land analysis can be performed.</p>
subject: Peterborough

title: Peterborough 2005 Orthoimagery
description: <p>High resolution aerial imagery (orthophotos) for the city of Peterborough, Ontario captured in the spring of 2005. These data are used in land use planning, land survey research, population and diversity studies, and utilities evaluations, to name a few.<br><br>Coordinate system: UTM - NAD'83, Zone 17<br>Aerial photography date: spring 2005<br>Ground pixel resolution: 20cm<br>Approximate file size per tile: 3MB</p>
subject: Peterborough; Orthoimagery

title: South St. Catharines Streetlights
description: <p>Point data locating streetlights from downtown to Brock area. Attribute table includes Pole No., wattage, street name, street type, street side and offset street.</p>
subject: St. Catharines

title: St. Catharines Transit 2015
description: <p>The St. Catharines Transit Commission has generously provided complete transit system data including bus stops and all transit routes for the city, and additional network data for public transportation planning. These data compliment the <a href="https://niagaraopendata.ca/dataset/public-transit-routes">Niagara Region Transit layers</a>. </p>
subject: Transportation

title: St. Catharines Official Plan 2014
description: <p>These GIS layers support the Garden City Official Plan 2014. For example: heritage districts, transportation network, bicycle network, municipal structure, general land use, land use designation, parklands, trail systems, potential development constraints and community improvement areas. Licensed data includes vector layers for Schedules B, D, E, F and G.  </p>
subject: St. Catharines

title: Landcover 2002 Greater Toronto Area
description: <p>Grid and layer files describing landcover for the GTA. Southern Ontario Land Resource Information System (SOLRIS) is a regional, ecologically based, land cover / land use inventory. The Landcover 2002 Greater Toronto Area is a modified version of SOLRIS. It provides a comprehensive, landscape-level inventory of natural, rural and urban areas in the GTA. The overall classification accuracy is approximately 80% and the minimum mapping unit is approximately 1 hectare. The pixel size is 15m x 15m. This data is suitable for regional scale mapping. The inventory represents the landscape current to 2002.<br><br>Data classes include: water (deep/shallow, urban water), urban, extraction, sparse forest, deciduous forest, mixed forest, coniferous forest, open wetland, treed wetland, agriculture - pasture/cropland, bare rock, urban greenspace, cloud/shadow.</p>
subject: Land Use

title: CASI-1500 VNIR (hyperspectral) Imagery (Osoyoos, BC)
description: <p>The CASI-1500 is an airborne sensor that captures hyperspectral visible near Infrared (VNIR) imagery with a 1500 pixel field of view, at 1.5 m resolution. This remote sensing image of the agricultural area in Osoyoos, British Columbia has been supplied for academic purposes by ITRES Research. CASI-1500 hyperspectral VNIR imagery has been used in applications such as detecting crop disease, mapping wetland species, water quality.<br><br>Read<br>more: <a href="https://itres.com/sensor-line-1-high-fidelity-hyperspectral-sensor-system/">https://itres.com/sensor-line-1-high-fidelity-hyperspectral-sensor-system/</a><br><br>GENERAL SCENE DESCRIPTION (Please refer to imagery metadata document for specific details of each scene.)<br><br>Airborne sensor: CASI-1500<br>Aircraft velocity: 120 knots<br>Aircraft altitude: ~3000m AGL<br>Bandwidth: 7.2nm<br>Spectral Range:<br>Band 01 = 367.2nm +/- 3.6nm<br>Band 72 = 1046.7nm +/- 3.6nm<br>Date: August 1, 2012<br>Format: .img, .hdr<br>Resolution: 1.5m pixel resolution<br>Sky Conditions: clear</p>
subject: Remote Sensing

title: CASI-1500 VNIR (hyperspectral) Imagery (University of Calgary, AB)
description: <p>The CASI-1500 is an airborne sensor that captures hyperspectral visible near Infrared (VNIR) imagery with a 1500 pixel field of view, achieving spatial resolutions as high as 25 cm. This sample image of the University of Calgary campus has been supplied for academic purposes by ITRES Research. CASI-1500 hyperspectral VNIR imagery has been used in applications such as detecting crop disease, mapping wetland species, water quality.<br><br>Read<br>more: <a href="https://itres.com/sensor-line-1-high-fidelity-hyperspectral-sensor-system/">https://itres.com/sensor-line-1-high-fidelity-hyperspectral-sensor-system</a><br><br>GENERAL SCENE DESCRIPTION (Please refer to imagery metadata document for specific details of each scene.)<br><br>Airborne sensor: CASI-1500<br>Aircraft velocity: 120 knots<br>Aircraft altitude: ~1100 m AGL<br>Bandwidth: 18.8 nm<br>Spectral Range:<br>Band 01 = 384.8 nm +/- 18.9 nm<br>Band 18 = 1029.7 nm +/- 18.9 nm<br>Date: October 23, 2006<br>Format: .pix, .hdr<br>Spatial Resolution: 25 cm</p>
subject: Remote Sensing

title: Canadian Weather Stations
description: <p>Data includes 1480 weather stations organized by province/territory. These point data reflect information found on Environment Canada's National Climate Data and Information<br>Archive: <a href="http://climate.weather.gc.ca/climate_normals/index_e.html"> http://climate.weather.gc.ca/climate_normals/index_e.html</a><br><br>Each Province includes a shapefile and a layer file for symbology.</p>
subject: Weather Stations

title: Canada Land Use Monitoring Program (CLUMP)
description: <p>Vector land use data collected in two phases consisting of the following years: [1966, 1971, 1976] and [1981-1986] with differing land use/activity/land cover classifications for urban areas across Canada.</p>
subject: Land Use

title: DMTI Postal Code Suite
description: <p>National coverage of six-digit Postal Code points, Local Delivery Units and Forward Sortation Areas. The suite also includes a table linking postal data to census boundaries for 1996, 2001, 2006, and 2011. Forward Sortation Areas are also available through Scholars GeoPortal.The MEP, or Multiple Enhanced Postal Code product is a precision point file representing over 1 million postal codes across Canada.<br><br>MEP contains postal code data including a single link indicator (identifies main postal code when multiple exist), reference dates, and points of call for various kinds of structures and buildings with multiple postal codes associated.<br><br>The MEP product contains a Multiple Enhanced Postal Code Unique Identifier which can be used to link postal codes to census geographies, using the Postal to Census Translation Table (a separate table used for linking purposes).</p>
subject: Postal Code

title: DMTI Enhanced Points of Interest
description: <p>The Enhanced Points of Interest data by DMTI Spatial is a national database of approximately 1 million Canadian business and recreational points of interest. Each point of interest has been accurately geocoded and specifically placed to provide the highest quality for location based analysis. Features include: car pool parking lots, educational institutions, financial institutions, hotels, shopping malls, gas stations, health care facilities, tourist sites, police services and golf courses; to name a few. For a complete listing of points available see the documentation files.<br><br>This data is made available through the SMART program data subscription for educational institutions across Canada by DMTI Spatial, Inc.</p>
subject: Points of Interest

title: DMTI Neighbourhoods Boundaries
description: <p>A boundary file representing neighbourhoods in Canadian communities.</p>
subject: Neighbourhoods

title: DMTI Parks & Recreation
description: <p>The CanMap Parks data is a national database of parks and recreation locations, and sports and race tracks. Features include: parks (national, provincial, other); wildlife areas and migratory bird sanctuaries; amusement park; campgrounds; cemeteries; golf courses; historic sites; picnic sites; and zoos, to name a few.<br><br>This data is made available through the SMART program data subscription for educational institutions across Canada by DMTI Spatial, Inc.</p>
subject: Parks

title: DMTI Water
description: <p>Vector layers reflecting water features by province based on 1:50,000 scale mapping. Features include points, lines and polygons for major and minor hydrology.</p>
subject: Hydrology;  Water

title: DMTI Land Use Layer
description: <p>A vector layer for major Canadian communities including land use categories such as: commercial, government/institutional, open area, parks & recreational, residential, resource & industrial and waterbody.</p>
subject: Land Use

title: GeoGratis
description: <p>Developed by Natural Resources Canada, this is a one stop shop for geospatial data, topographic and geoscience maps, images and scientific publications.  Easy to search, view and download, and completely FREE! Instructions for using GeoGratis are available.</p>
subject: GeoGratis

title: GeoBase
description: <p>Developed by the Canadian Council on Geomatics (CCOG), this portal offers easy access to remote sensing imagery, administrative boundaries, National Hydro Network, National Power Line Network, National Railway Network or the National Road Network.</p>
subject: GeoBase

title: Census Mapper
description: <p>Interactive census mapping for all of Canada.</p>
subject: Census

title: Census 2016
description: <p>As the census is being released, data tables can be accessed <a href="https://bit.ly/3GkJeUM">here</a>.</p>
subject: Census

title: Census Profiles Tables (CHASS)
description: <p>Site provides census data and documention for various years of the census of Canada. NOTE: access is limited to valid Brock University academia only. This is the University of Toronto portal for Statistics Canada Census data. Census data profile tables are used for census mapping. </p>
subject: Census

title: Geography Files (Scholars GeoPortal)
description: <p>Cartographic boundary files are available by searching the GeoPortal or by direct download from Statistics Canada. Geographic boundaries include census dissemination areas, census tracts, census divisions, census subdivisions, federal electoral districts, etc.</p>
subject: Census

title: Elections Ontario Geography Files
description: <p>Polling divisions are available in PDF maps and GIS shapefile format for the province of Ontario.</p>
subject: Elections Ontario

title: Health Region Boundary Files
description: <p>Health region boundaries including Public health units and Local Health Integration Network.</p>
subject: Ontario; Health

title: DMTI CanMap Route Logistics (Roads)
description: <p>National vector data including roads, highways, street names and address ranges, routing attributes (Route Hierarchy, Roads, Highways, Rush Traffic, Median, Speed Limits and Travel Time), other transportation features, points of interest, parks, populated placenames, Canadian area code boundaries, Canadian time zones boundaries, general water features and municipal/provincial/federal boundaries.</p>
subject: Transportation

title: National Hydro Network
description: <p>Geospatial vector data describing hydrographic features such as lakes, reservoirs, rivers, streams, canals, islands, obstacles and constructions</p>
subject: Hydrology; Water

title: U.S. Census Bureau
description: <p>Site offers details, interactive mapping and data download for the American Census.</p>
subject: Census; United States

title: USGS Earth Explorer
description: <p>Landsat 1-8 Imagery (including thermal), ASTER, Elevation Data, Vegetation index, Land Cover, Tree Cover; Global coverage. Access remote sensing data of the world captured by various satellite sensor platforms. These data are freely available for direct download. A tutorial is available.</p>
subject: United States

title: LandsatLook Viewer
description: <p>Using an interactive map, explore landsat archived remote sensing images, view metadata and download full-band source Landsat satellite imagery.</p>
subject: Remote Sensing; Satellite Imagery

title: DIVA-GIS
description: <p>This site offers direct download for most countries across the world. Includes administrative areas, inland water, roads, railroads, elevation, land cover, population in shapefile, Grid or DBF format. Source data is mainly Digital Chart of the World.</p>
subject: World

title: ArcGIS Online
description: <p>ArcGIS Online is a collaborative, cloud-based platform that allows you to create, store and manage maps, apps and data, and share them with others. You also get access to maps and apps shared by Esri and GIS users around the world. ArcGIS.com has many tools for managing your content. You can upload different types of data, such as packages, and desktop files like MXDs and LYRs and you also get 2 GB of storage in the secure cloud. A free ESRI Global Account is required.</p>
subject: ArcGIS

title: Natural Earth
description: <p>Free downloads containing vector and raster datasets of the world. This data is available in 1:10 million, 1:50 million and 1:100 million scales. Themes include water (lakes, rivers), major highways, roads, coastlines and country boundaries, to name a few.</p>
subject: Natural Earth

title: Environment Canada Climate Data
description: <p>Monthly, daily and hourly climate data are available for Environment Canada weather stations through this website. A tutorial is available.</p>
subject: Environment Canada; Climate

title: GeoScan
description: <p>Access geology maps (GSC) and data using the Advanced Search option.</p>
subject: GeoScan

title: National Atlas of Canada
description: <p>Access archived map content from the National Atlas of Canada series, Federal Elections, Glacier Atlas, National Parks and more.</p>
subject: Canada

title: OCUL Historical Topographic Maps Digitization Project
description: <p>Historical topographic maps have been digitized, georeferenced and are available through this discovery portal.</p>
subject: Topographic maps

title: Toronto Transit Commission (TTC)
description: <p>These data layers include surface route (bus, streetcar) and Rapid Transit information for the city of Toronto, Ontario. Attribute details include stops, routes, route number, name, mode of transit, night service (if applicable).</p>
subject: Transportation

title: Ontario Make a Topographic Map
description: <p>Customize a topographic map for your research area in the province of Ontario.</p>
subject: Topographic maps

title: Niagara Orthoimagery 2018
description: <p>High resolution aerial imagery for the Niagara Region. This orthoimagery includes Niagara municipal mosaics of the spring 2018 imagery. The Region is also available by 1 km tiles. These data are used in land use planning, water management, urban studies and infrastructure, natural resources, to name a few.<br><br>Coordinate system: UTM - NAD'83, Zone 17<br>Imagery date: spring 2018<br>Ground pixel resolution: 20 cm<br>Format: TIF, JP2<br>Approximate file size per tile: 2GB - 13GB<br>Organized by municipality or 1 km tiles</p>
subject: Orthoimagery

title: Worldview-4 Satellite Imagery, July 3, 2017
description: <p>NiagaraFallsPark_WV4_MS_Geotiff.zip - This file contains 4-Band Multispectral imagery only that has been orthorectified and is at the native 1.2m resolution <br>NiagaraFallsPark_WV4_Pan_Geotiff.zip - This file contains Panchromatic (Black & White) imagery only that has been orthorectified and is at the native 30cm resolution <br>NiagaraFallsPark_WV4_RGB_Geotiff.zip - This file contains 3-Band Pan-Sharpened Natural Color (RGB) imagery that has been orthorectified and is at the 30cm resolution<br>NiagaraFallsPark_WV4_RGBN_Geotiff.zip - This file contains 4-Band Pan-Sharpened (RGBNIR) imagery that has been orthorectified and is at the 30cm resolution</p>
subject: Remote Sensing; Satellite Imagery

title: Worldview-2 Satellite Imagery, July 8, 2017
description: <p>Remote sensing Worldview-2 satellite imagery for the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. Ortho Ready Standard high resolution satellite data used to study land use, land cover, agriculture, urban growth, transportation networks, deforestation, water pollution, and other earth surface features.<br><br>Satellite: WorldView-2 Niagara-on-the-Lake<br>Date: July 8, 2017<br>Format: GeoTIFF<br>Resolution: 50 cm (pan); 2 m (multi-spectral)<br>Sensor Mode: PAN/MS<br>Cloud Cover: 0%<br>Bands: panchromatic & multispectral, B, G, R and near-infrared<br>Image processing: Ortho-Ready Standard<br><br><br>Spectral Characteristics:<br><br>400-450 nm (coastal)<br>450-510 nm (blue)<br>510-580 nm (green<br>585-625nm(yellow)<br>630-690nm(red)<br>705-745 (red edge)<br>770-895 (near IR-1)<br>860-900 nm (near IR-2)<br><br>Pan (B&W): 450-800</p>
subject: Remote Sensing; Satellite Imagery

title: Worldview-2 & 3 Satellite Imagery, July 31, 2023
description: <p>Remote sensing Worldview-2 satellite imagery for the town of Lincoln. Ortho Ready Standard high resolution satellite data used to study land use, land cover, agriculture, urban growth, transportation networks, deforestation, water pollution, and other earth surface features.<br><br>Satellite: WorldView-2&3 Lincoln<br>Date: July 31, 2023<br>Format: GeoTIFF<br>Resolution: 50 cm (pan); 2 m (multi-spectral)<br>Sensor Mode: PAN/MS<br>Cloud Cover: 0%<br>Bands: panchromatic & multispectral, B, G, R and near-infrared<br>Image processing: Ortho-Ready Standard<br><br><br>Spectral Characteristics:<br><br>400-450 nm (coastal)<br>450-510 nm (blue)<br>510-580 nm (green)<br>585-625 nm(yellow)<br>630-690 nm(red)<br>705-745 (red edge)<br>770-895 (near IR-1)<br>860-1040 nm (near IR-2)<br><br>Pan (B&W): 450-800</p>
subject: Remote Sensing; Satellite Imagery

title: Niagara Orthoimagery 2023
description: <p>High resolution (10cm) aerial imagery for the Niagara Region. This orthoimagery includes the 12 municipalities of Niagara captured in the  spring of 2023. These data are used in land use planning, water management, urban studies, climate change and natural resources, to name a few.</p>
subject: Orthoimagery

title: Niagara Region Building Footprints 2023
description: <p>Detailed building footprints captured from high resolution orthorimagery and includes the 12 municipalities of Niagara captured in the  spring of 2023. These data are used in land use planning, urban studies, and natural resources, to name a few.</p>
subject: Land Use
